A: 1. God provides needs like food, shelter, and clothes for his _ (a) pets (b) children (c) enemies (d) animals
2. God makes the sun shine on both good and _ people (a) bad (b) evil (c) kind (d) just
3. God sends rain on both the just and the _ (a) unjust (b) good (c) wise (d) faithful
4. God's love brings sinners to _ (a) joy (b) wealth (c) repentance (d) power
5. God sent his only begotten son, Jesus, to the world to perform _ (a) speeches (b) miracles (c) dances (d) plays
6. Jesus had pity on the sick, lame, and _ (a) rich (b) strong (c) blind (d) healthy
7. Jesus gave hope to the _ (a) hopeless (b) powerful (c) happy (d) angry
8. Jesus was nailed to the _ and died for sins (a) tree (b) cross (c) wall (d) stone
9. Jesus shed his blood for the forgiveness of _ (a) debts (b) sins (c) pain (d) money
10. Jesus told us we should love one another and be perfect as our _ Father (a) earthly (b) human (c) heavenly (d) spiritual
11. Blind Bartimeaus was sitting by the _ (a) house (b) roadside (c) well (d) market
12. Bartimeaus cried out to Jesus, "Jesus, son of _" (a) God (b) Man (c) David (d) Abraham
13. Jesus asked Bartimeaus, "What do you want me to do for _" (a) you (b) me (c) them (d) us
14. Bartimeaus wanted to receive his _ (a) money (b) food (c) sight (d) garment
15. Jesus told Bartimeaus, "Go your way; your _ has made you well" (a) tears (b) shouting (c) faith (d) family
16. Zacchaeus was a chief tax collector and a _ man (a) poor (b) rich (c) sick (d) old
17. Zacchaeus climbed a _ tree to see Jesus (a) oak (b) sycamore (c) fig (d) palm
18. Jesus told Zacchaeus he must stay at his _ today (a) house (b) office (c) church (d) shop
19. People murmured because Jesus wanted to be the guest of a _ (a) saint (b) leader (c) sinner (d) friend
20. Zacchaeus promised to give half of his goods to the _ (a) rich (b) poor (c) tax collectors (d) family
21. Zacchaeus promised to pay back _ times the amount if he cheated anyone (a) two (b) three (c) four (d) five
22. Jesus said salvation had come to Zacchaeus's _ (a) city (b) street (c) house (d) tree
23. Jesus came to seek and to save the _ (a) found (b) lost (c) sick (d) healthy
24. Jesus drove out seven demons from _ Magdalene (a) Martha (b) Mary (c) Sarah (d) Leah
25. Showing love to one another brings _ among people (a) fights (b) peace (c) sadness (d) anger
26. Showing love makes us draw closer to one another and to _ (a) money (b) power (c) God (d) fame
27. Showing love to one another brings _ (a) division (b) unity (c) conflict (d) sorrow
28. Showing love to one another brings joy and _ among people (a) sadness (b) happiness (c) anger (d) fear
29. When Jesus was about to ascend, he promised his disciples the _ Spirit (a) Evil (b) Human (c) Holy (d) Earthly
30. The Holy Spirit would teach the world righteousness and condemn _ (a) good (b) evil (c) truth (d) kindness
31. The Holy Spirit was sent on the twelve apostles on _ Day (a) Sabbath (b) Easter (c) Pentecost (d) Christmas
32. The Holy Spirit guided early disciples in spreading the _ (a) news (b) Gospel (c) rumors (d) laws
33. Paul and Barnabas were called for _ work (a) farming (b) missionary (c) building (d) fishing
34. Paul cast out an evil spirit from a slave girl who was practicing _ (a) singing (b) soothsaying (c) dancing (d) cooking
35. The owners of the slave girl took Paul and Silas to the _ (a) king (b) magistrates (c) temple (d) market
36. Paul and Silas were beaten with _ (a) hands (b) ropes (c) stones (d) rods
37. Paul and Silas were put in the _ prison (a) outer (b) inner (c) main (d) small
38. Paul and Silas were singing at midnight when God sent an _ (a) flood (b) earthquake (c) fire (d) storm
39. The prison guard wanted to _ himself (a) save (b) kill (c) help (d) free
40. Paul told the magistrates they should _ to them (a) thank (b) apologize (c) commend (d) punish
B: 1. What did Jesus shed for the forgiveness of sins? _________
2. What kind of tree did Zacchaeus climb? _________
3. What day was the Holy Spirit sent on the twelve apostles? _________
4. Who was chosen along with Paul for missionary work? _________
5. What was the magician called who tried to buy the power of the Holy Spirit? _________
C: 1. Name two gifts of the Holy Spirit mentioned in the text.
2. List two roles of the Holy Spirit in the life of present-day Christians.
3. According to Paul, what is one quality a person with the Holy Spirit manifests?
4. What does a new life in Christ mean?
5. State one reason why Jesus prayed.
answers_C: Wisdom to preach the Gospel, Power to perform miracles of healing
Enables to hate life of sin, Enables to fellowship with one another
A changed life, giving up sinful ways
